intro: Chylismia brevipes, commonly known as the narrow-footed chylismia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a short, stout stem with finely divided leaves. Its botanical features include a compact growth habit and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Chylismia brevipes is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
